verses.verse: To the chief Musician<WH5329> on Neginoth<WH5058> upon Sheminith<WH8067>, A Psalm<WH4210> of David<WH1732>. O LORD<WH3068>, rebuke<WH3198> me not in thine anger<WH639>, neither chasten<WH3256> me in thy hot displeasure<WH2534>.
Have mercy<WH2603> upon me, O LORD<WH3068>; for I am weak<WH536>: O LORD<WH3068>, heal<WH7495> me; for my bones<WH6106> are vexed<WH926>.
My soul<WH5315> is also sore<WH3966> vexed<WH926>: but thou, O LORD<WH3068>, how long?
Return<WH7725>, O LORD<WH3068>, deliver<WH2502> my soul<WH5315>: oh save<WH3467> me for thy mercies'<WH2617> sake.
For in death<WH4194> there is no remembrance<WH2143> of thee: in the grave<WH7585> who shall give thee thanks<WH3034>?
I am weary<WH3021> with my groaning<WH585>; all the night<WH3915> make I my bed<WH4296> to swim<WH7811>; I water<WH4529> my couch<WH6210> with my tears<WH1832>.
Mine eye<WH5869> is consumed<WH6244> because of grief<WH3708>; it waxeth old<WH6275> because of all mine enemies<WH6887>.
Depart<WH5493> from me, all ye workers<WH6466> of iniquity<WH205>; for the LORD<WH3068> hath heard<WH8085> the voice<WH6963> of my weeping<WH1065>.
The LORD<WH3068> hath heard<WH8085> my supplication<WH8467>; the LORD<WH3068> will receive<WH3947> my prayer<WH8605>.
Let all mine enemies<WH341> be ashamed<WH954> and sore<WH3966> vexed<WH926>: let them return<WH7725> and be ashamed<WH954> suddenly<WH7281>.
